column4: can somebody help me real quick i need to get in administrator mode how do i do it
Reboot, escape to get the grub menu, then select recovery mode.
What are you trying to do?
You don't have administrator access?
Which drivers are you installing?
Hmm. Not sure, really.
Which version are you using?
- so do u know what i have to type in the terminal to access administrator mode
Preface whatever command you're using with sudo
It will then ask you for your password, and run the command as administrator.
Err... You can't install video drivers in wine, can you?
- well it opened up wizard but i guess i'll try with just linux
I've never had to install windows drivers for wine.
- well i dont kno what to install then cuz fglrx messes my graphics up and when i reboot it takes me to a black screen so i have to uninstall that
Have you read this thread yet? http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1137467

Apparently, there are issues with x200 and jaunty.
